item.title: Exploring some Key Components of Room (#OF03)
item.description:
Key Components

Primarily, there are three important components: Entity, DAO’s, and Database, The entity represent a table. Dao’s are an interface to write queries and define your operations. The database is where you associate your entities and include the dao’s you would like to access from outside; hence, it’s the entry point of your database. Let’s check it out one by one:

item.description:

Official Documentation

The Google team keeps the document up-to-date, and has a simper set-up guide so feel free to check it out. item.title: Upgrading Your App to Offline First With Room (#OF01)
item.description:
Why Should You Care?

Making your app offline-first is essential if you want to provide the best user experience. It makes your app significantly faster by reducing the number of network calls, which in turn also reduces server costs.

What does Offline-First mean?

The core idea is to persist/store remote-fetched data on the device. This allows users to access the data instantly, skipping unnecessary network requestsâ€”until the data expires or is invalidated.

item.title: Exploring Solid Principles With kotlin
item.description:

They are a set of guidelines that help you write code that is easy to understand, maintain, and extend.
